anchor.surface_text: The matter was again companysidered by the Calcutta High Court in Kshetra Mohan Das v. D. C. Basu 5 in companynection with a deposit made by a sole, selling agent and the principle for deciding whether the deposit was in the nature of a trust or a loan was put thus.

precedents.case_name: Kshetra Mohan Das v D C Basu
precedents.cited_proposition: If the security deposit of an employee or an agent of a company in the hands of such company can be regarded as impressed with trust or held in a fiduciary capacity then such employee or agent is entitled to the whole of the security deposit even after company goes to liquidation. In the absence of trust or fiduciary relation the employee or the agent is merely a creditor
precedents.cited_holding: principle for deciding if deposit is trust or loan depends on facts and circumstances

precedents.cited_holding: where a trust can be inferred clearly a provision for payment of interest would be immaterial
